newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: SIMEX Nikkei futures end weak ahead U.S. data.
newsitem.headline: SIMEX Nikkei futures end weak ahead U.S. data.

text.p: SIMEX Nikkei futures ended lower on Friday following the Dow's 50-point slide overnight due to nervousness about the typically volatile U.S. jobs report due at 1230 GMT.
After hitting a low of 20,135, the benchmark Nikkei 225 September contract finished at 20,260 against a previous settlement at 20,405. Turnover was at 19,395 lots.
In Tokyo, the 225-share Nikkei average ended down 227.29 points at 20,152.53.
A trader with a European futures house said the September Nikkei should grind higher provided it managed to hold above 20,000 points.
He said Japanese public funds had been good buyers on Nikkei markets in the past week and half-year profit forecasts indicated strength in some sectors of Japan's economy.
"The banking sector is recovering nicely and taking advantage of its artificially increased margins," he said.
